https://carsandbids.com/auctions/3zJRPW0.auction_subtitle: ~59,300 Miles, 520-hp Twin-Turbo V8, Highly Equipped, Reviewed by Doug DeMuro
https://carsandbids.com/auctions/3zJRPW0.dougs_take: The original Porsche Cayenne Turbo S was a serious performance SUV that had real sporty credentials – boasting 520 horsepower from a turbocharged V8 – AND exceptional off-road capabilities, with height-adjustable suspension and a locking center differential. This particular Cayenne Turbo S touts reasonably low mileage for one of these, and it features a stealthy look, courtesy of the black on black color scheme and black exterior accents. It's also nicely equipped with 20-inch Cayenne SportDesign wheels, factory wheel spacers, heated front and rear seats, and a rear-view camera. Plus, this Cayenne Turbo S comes with a clean, accident-free Carfax report, for added buyer confidence.
auction_highlights: This Cayenne's odometer currently displays about 59,300 miles.
The attached Carfax vehicle history report shows no accidents or mileage discrepancies in this Cayenne’s past.

According to the build sheet provided in the gallery, factory equipment includes 20-inch Cayenne SportDesign wheels, wheel spacers, height-adjustable air suspension, rocker panel extensions, roof rails, thermally insulated glass, a sunroof, heated front and rear seats, a Bose sound system, and more as detailed below. Modifications reported by the selling dealer are limited to an aftermarket ECU tune, Fabspeed high-flow rear catalytic converters, a rear badge delete, and a Parrot Bluetooth module.

Called "955" internally, the first-generation Cayenne made its American debut for the 2003 model year. It was a hugely controversial model at launch, but it quickly won over skeptics with its unusual blend of on-road performance and off-road prowess. It retired as the best-selling member of the Porsche range in 2010, and its replacement arrived shortly after.

Power comes from a 4.5-liter twin-turbocharged V8, rated at 520 horsepower and 530 lb-ft of torque in stock form. Due to the modifications performed to this Cayenne, it may produce more power, but a dyno sheet was not provided to confirm. Output is sent to all four wheels through a 6-speed automatic transmission.
